description.value:
You are a member of a guild of artisans, skilled in a particular field and in close contact with other artisans. You are familiar with the world of markets, freed from the constraints of a feudal social order thanks to your talent and wealth. You learned your craft as an apprentice under a master artisan, under the aegis of your guild, until you became a master in your branch yourself.

Mastered Skills: Intuition, Persuasion

Mastered Tools: a type of artisan's tool

Languages: one of your choice

Equipment: a set of artisan's tools (of your choice), a letter of recommendation from your guild, travel clothes, and a purse containing 15 gp.

Feature: @Compendium[5e-complete-fr.5e-backgrounds.Item.y6XhCDzLfEJ9GorO]

Suggested Personalities

Charlatans are colorful characters who hide their true personality behind masks they craft. They adapt to what people want to see, what they want to believe, and their way of seeing the world. But their true personality is sometimes tormented by a crisis of conscience, an old enemy, or a scheme gone wrong.

Variants

Instead of being a guild artisan, you could be a member of a guild of merchants, caravan masters, or traders. You do not make the items yourself but earn your living by buying and reselling the work of others (or the raw materials needed by artisans). Your guild could be a large consortium of merchants (or a family) with interests all over the region. You might transport goods from one place to another by boat, cart, or caravan, or buy from traveling merchants and resell in your own shop. In a way, the life of a traveling merchant lends itself more to adventure than that of an artisan.

Instead of proficiency with a type of artisan's tool, you gain proficiency with navigator's tools or an additional language. And instead of having artisan's tools, you can start with a mule and a cart.
